ygData.subject: Re: Price Fixing
ygData.msgSnippet: ...stupid things like selling below cost.... Well, lets see, cost of a banded tunic.... Small Bricks of Ore - Free, or can buy from players for usually 3 or
ygData.messageBody:
"...stupid things like selling below cost...."

Well, lets see, cost of a banded tunic....
Small Bricks of Ore - Free, or can buy from players for usually 3 or 4 gp
3 waters - 4sp
tunic mold - 1pp? (sorry don't remember real price, never paid real close attention when buying molds)
So we're talking less than a few plat to make a tunic....at cost would be below 10pp, below cost would be below 5pp....yep, I would have to agree there, that would be pretty stupid, but I've yet to see anybody selling stuff that cheap.

So selling a tunic for 20pp is a BIG profit, for me that'd be about 15pp profit. Selling for 15pp is still a nice profit of about 10pp. Taking any more profit than that is pure greed. So I'll continue to sell my tunic and leggings for 15plat ea.
So do you concider cost of materials for your failures? if so, You charge people for your lack of skill?



<<< "John Cuyle" <johncuyle@...> 5/19 7:36p >>>
From: "John Cuyle" <johncuyle@...>

Prices on banded should be at least as much as chain. Smiths who sell lower
than that are doing a terrible disservice to their fellow smiths. All
Verant needs to do to fix this problem is make merchants pay a reasonable
amount for smithed goods, then we wouldn't see stupid things like people
selling at or below cost.
----- Original Message -----
